channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trees blocking street light, 16th September
item.description:
Tree is blocking the street light alongside Lower Sydenham station at the entrance to the 'lower Sydenham pocket park'

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westerley Crescent, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 63 Canfield Gardens, 16th September
item.description:
A trench was dug for laying fibre, and infilled, but it has now settled too far and there is now a substantial dip. When busses hit this our whole building shakes so much that the windows rattle. This is causing cracks in masonry and plaster and this will cost me a lot to fix. Please fix the hole. This is the second report for the same problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Canfield Gardens, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Exposed wires / electric box, 16th September
item.description:
Exposed electric box that has exposed wires and has been that way for weeks. This is a serious hazard to any children playing in the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Rotherhithe New Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside No. 5 Canfield Place, 16th September
item.description:
Thames Water excavated the road, and repaired a leak. Pit left open for 1 week, with perimeter barriers. After a further 1 week, the pit was backfilled with hard material to within 200 mm of surface, and left with perimeter barriers. After a further 2 weeks, while the road has remained closed to lorry traffic and Veolia refuse collection, the barriers have been pushed aside, blown over by recent winds, and the part-backfilled pit remains in dangerous condition.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5a, Canfield Place, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Bin overflowing again

item.title: Domestic waste repeatedly being put in bush shelter bin outside No 7 Herne Hill., 16th September
item.description:
Someone local has been putting their domestic waste into the bus shelter bin outside 7 Herne Hill for over a year now. In the last week this waste has been deposited the day after the bin has been emptied. Overflowing waste goes into adjacent gardens. What an be done? Are we entitled to go through the bags to identify the owner, or is that up to the council? Please let us know.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herne Hill, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Freestanding litter bin, 16th September
item.description:
The bin report covered by ref number 8169504 has NOT been dealt with and remains in the same location outside 74 The Drive, Beckenham, Kent, BR3 1EQ. How much more precise can this location be? Visited? I donâ€™t think so!????
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No shop front licence on display in window (as per the terms), 16th September
item.description:
Failure to display in window a valid shop fronts licence is a breach of the terms for that licence. Please enforce to ensure window display of licence.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Broadway Market, Hackney, London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Holden Road, Woodside Park, London

item.title: Loose pavement bricks, 16th September
item.description:
Pavement bricks have become loose outside the entrance door of 205 High Street and also where it meets 207 High Street. It is a trip hazard and not safe. It has been like this for over 2 weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 205, High Street, Penge, London

item.title: Rubbish blocking pavement on junction of Bellenden Road and Oxenford Street, 16th September
item.description:
Empty flat pack boxes and general bin bags of waste have been dumped on the corner of Oxenford Street and Bellenden Road. The pavement is completely blocked, so wheelchair/pushchair users cannot pass and pedestrians have to walk in the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Oxenford Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 6 bags of rubble fly discarded on pavement, 16th September
item.description:
The bags are located beside the entrance of a private garage between 1 Admaston Road and the back of estate agent Beaumont Gibbs at 134-136 Plumstead High Road. We have noticed these rubble bags for the past 10 days. There is also a mini traffic cone beside the bags. They are causing an obstruction on the pavement and have been illegally dumped.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Admaston Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
